intro: Spilanthes callimorpha, commonly known as the devil's bit scabwort, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Spilanthes callimorpha is also known for its peppery scent and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
